title: Government Travel
content:
Hello Everybody,

I’m tasked with putting some lipstick on [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.govtrip.com/govtrip/site/grphx/logo.gif).

Attached are the initial ideas hashed out a bit. I like the flag from the original, and just thought it needed some tightening up. Thoughts?

comments.content:
Nice work on these. I’ll leave the critique for others, but I do like your take on the flag logo.

Sharon

thoughts are ... it’s looking good.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Bicycle Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.bicyclefilmfestival.com.au/)  
 [Student Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)

I like the ones with the spherical treatment of the mark in v2b, and the ones in v2 with the square sans (Klavika?). Careful it doesn’t end up looking too lemony.

- Lex

Thanks so much Sharon, Paul, & Lex! Glad to have any feedback.  
It’s “six-of-one, half-dozen of the other” for me... but I would like to make a decent departure from the original and go with the [bottom-left on v2](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/typophile.com/files/logotype-explorations-v2.gif), or either on [top at v2b](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/typophile.com/files/logotype-explorations-v2b.gif).

The fonts are Union, Demos Bold, and FF Clan. Maybe switch the FF Clan to Praxis Bold... then fiddle ’til it looks good.

Wrapping the “flag stripes on a globe” (US Government... travel... get it?) was the idea for the spherical treatment of the mark in v2b, without making it look like a barber-shop pole. Though users saying “_even their logo is a lemon!_” would be bad too — as they’re getting hammered on usability of the site (that’s the next task).

I could even [animate that globe](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.logolounge.com/articles/default.asp?ArticleID=638), but I’m trying to be somewhat simple and classical and [not trendy](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.logolounge.com/articles/default.asp?ArticleID=607).

hah! the second set of logos has the ’bacon strips’ in them. Stay away from the bacon strips.

My school’s tried to rock the bacon strips for a long time now, and they’ve never been able to pull them off

[http://www.sl.on.ca](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207232805/http:/www.sl.on.ca/ "http://www.sl.on.ca")

BEWARE!

I really like the bottom left v2, I think it is a very strong mark that says “Government” to me. The type as well as the flag work very well together. The color is also nice, although Red & Government seem kind of scary together. My first instinct is that it should be green or blue, but I really like the red.
